verses.verse: But false prophets were among the people, even as there will be false teachers among you, who will secretly and deceptively bring in destructive heresies, even rejecting the Lord that redeemed them. They will bring on themselves swift destruction.
Many will follow their destructive ways; because of them others will curse the way of truth.
Through selfish desires, they will use you to get rich with [their] deceptive words. For a long time now their judgment is anticipated, and their destruction is not asleep.
For God did not spare the angels that sinned, but threw [them] into hell and delivered [them] to chains of darkness to be reserved for judgment.
He did not spare the original world, but saved Noah, the eight [person], a preacher of righteousness, [and] brought the flood on that ungodly world.
And turning the cities of Sodom and Gomorrah into ashes, he sentenced them with destruction, making them an example of those who later would live ungodly,
but he delivered Lot, a just man, vexed by the filthy behavior of the wicked.
For that righteous man lived among them, and what he heard and saw vexed his righteous soul daily by their wicked actions.
The Lord knows how to deliver the godly out of temptations and to reserve the sinful for punishment on the Day of Judgment,

especially those who follow the flesh in the sensual desires of moral uncleanness and in despising authority. They are presumptuous, self-willed, and are not afraid to speak evil of those in authority.
Whereas angels, who are greater in power and strength, do not bring insults against them before the Lord.
But these like wild animals made to be captured and destroyed hurl insults about things that they don't understand and will utterly perish in their own corruption.

And they will receive the wages of unrighteousness, since they consider it a pleasure to live a sensual life all day long. [They are] stains and blemishes taking delight in their delusion even while they feast with you.
[Their] eyes are full of adultery, and they cannot get enough of sin. They seduce unstable souls; they train their heart for greed; they are cursed children.
They have forsaken the true way and wandered following the ways of Balaam, who loved the wages of unrighteousness,
but was rebuked for his sin. The donkey, which doesn't have human speech, speaking with a human voice kept the prophet from [his] irrational behavior.
These [people] are like wells without water, clouds blown around with a storm, to which the mist of darkness is reserved forever.
For they utter high-sounding nonsense [and] use sensual desires to seduce those who are truly escaped from filthy sins to live in error.
Though they promise them freedom, they are slaves of moral decay, for what a person is overcome by he is made a slave.

For if after they have escaped the pollutions of the world through their knowledge of the Lord and Savior Jesus Christ and again get involved in it and overcome, their latter end is worse for them than before they started.
For it would have been better for them to not have known the way of righteousness than after knowing it to turn from the holy commandment [which] was delivered to them.
What happened to them is according to the true proverb, "The dog returned to his own vomit," and "The pig that was washed to rolling in the mud."
